settings.title: Weight Loss
settings.subtitle: If you need assistance with weight loss, you have come to the right place. We have helped over 5000 clients achieve their weight loss goals. Search our treatment options below for effective weight loss pills and plans.

settings.title: What are weight loss pills?
settings.text: Weight loss pills are used to block the digestion of fat that has been consumed from your diet. These prescription medications block around a third of the total fat you have consumed and ensure it isn't absorbed into the body.

settings.title: What is the best weight loss plan?
settings.text: The best weight loss plans combine a healthy diet with regular exercise. Your doctor can help you to plan and adhere to these lifestyle changes and can suggest more specific treatments if you have any underlying medical problems associated with obesity.

settings.title: of men were found to be obese
settings.text: According to the NHS, in 2020, 67% of men and 60% of women were categorised as 'obese' as found in a report from a variety of sources around the UK.

settings.title: increase in hospital admissions where obesity was a factor
settings.text: According to the NHS, in 2020 there was a 23% increase in hospital admissions where obesity was a factor compared to 2017/18.

settings.title: Expert’s Opinion
settings.text: “Losing weight can be a difficult and challenging process, but it is possible to achieve your desired weight through dedication and hard work. While there is no magic bullet for weight loss, there are certain steps you can take to help you reach your goals. Creating a healthy diet and exercise plan, as well as making lifestyle changes, can help you lose weight safely and effectively. Getting regular exercise is another important part of any weight loss plan!”
settings.name: Dr Sameer Nakedar

settings.heading: How do Weight Loss Injections Work?

settings.text: Weight loss injections, such as those utilising the drug semaglutide, work by manipulating hormonal signals involved in appetite regulation and glucose metabolism, facilitating a reduction in caloric intake and subsequently leading to weight loss. Semaglutide is a synthetic analogue of glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1), a hormone that naturally occurs in the body and plays a crucial role in maintaining glucose homeostasis and influencing appetite. When injected, semaglutide binds to GLP-1 receptors, enhancing insulin secretion and suppressing glucagon release in a glucose-dependent manner, thereby aiding in the control of blood sugar levels. Simultaneously, it interacts with the appetite centers in the brain, diminishing hunger and enhancing feelings of fullness and satiety. This dual action not only aids in managing blood glucose levels but also reduces overall energy intake by modulating eating behaviors, leading to weight loss. Thus, through physiological and behavioural effects, weight loss injections such as Wegovy work to aid individuals in reducing their body weight and managing metabolic health.

settings.title: How do weight loss pills work?
settings.text: Weight loss pills block the absorption of fat into your body. They do this by preventing the functioning of the enzyme called lipase. Lipase helps to break down the dietary fat so that it can be absorbed. By blocking this enzyme, it ensures the fat passes through your body where it then gets excreted.

settings.title: How much weight can I lose using a weight loss pill?
settings.text: A weight loss pill can help you lose weight but it will be a modest amount. It will help to lose more pounds than you would normally lose with diet and exercise alone. Weight loss pills work best when combined with regular exercise and a healthy diet.

settings.title: How do I take a weight loss pill?
settings.text: Weight loss pills are taken within an hour of a fat-containing meal up to three times in a day.

settings.title: Who shouldn't take a weight loss pill?
settings.text: A weight loss pill is not recommended for pregnant or breastfeeding women. If you have a history of medical conditions or are already taking medications, you should consult with your doctor to make sure a weight loss pill is right for you.

settings.title: How long does it take to receive my order?
settings.text: All orders placed before 14:00 from Monday to Friday will be dispatched that day. The orders are sent using 24 Hour Tracked delivery provided by Royal Mail. Items will usually arrive the very next day after the order has been placed. We also provide tracking for your orders to check the status and location of your parcel.

settings.title: What is an online consultation?
settings.text: An online consultation checks if you are eligible to purchase the product. Some products only require an online consultation which approximately takes 1 minute to complete, enabling you to buy the product. Other products will also require a prescription; in this case, you will need to complete the online consultation, and then one of our partner pharmacy prescribers or doctors will review the online consultation questions and approve the order for delivery if you are eligible to purchase the item.

settings.title: How is the medication packaged?
settings.text: All our medication is packaged in plain confidential padded white or brown envelopes. This ensures that your orders are discreet, and the content of the orders will be for your eyes only.

settings.title: When will my order be delivered?
settings.text: If you have placed an order before 14:00 Monday to Friday, you will receive the order the next day.

settings.title: Can I return my order?
settings.text: For non-medicinal products, you are eligible to return the product within 14 days of receipt in the same packaging you received. For medicinal products, you are eligible to cancel the order only until it has been dispatched. From that point forward, you are no longer eligible to return the order.

settings.title: Can I cancel my order?
settings.text: You have the right to cancel your order for medication up to the point when your medication is dispatched.

settings.title: Is this medication suitable for me?
settings.text: Please get in touch with a doctor if you are unsure what medication is suitable for you. You can also complete our online consultation form to check your eligibility for the product.

settings.title: Can I order this if I am under 18 years old?
settings.text: No, we do not accept orders from individuals under 18. All orders must be placed by adults only.

settings.title: What is the difference between healthy and unhealthy weight loss?
settings.text: Medical professionals advise losing 1-2 lbs a week as a healthy weight loss range, any figures above this can be deemed as unhealthy amounts of weight loss especially if they are sustained to that level over a long period of time. To determine whether your current weight is healthy you must take your age, height and gender into consideration.

settings.title: Which type of weight loss medication is best for me?
settings.text: Weight loss medications are usually prescribed to those who have been unable to lose weight through natural lifestyle changes such as healthy eating and increased levels of exercise. The available medication can range from helping to stop additional fat from being absorbed or suppressing your appetite. Apetite supressing pillls are designed to be taken on a short-term basis whilst fat blockers can be taken for periods of up to 3 months.

settings.title: Do weight loss pills work if you are obese?
settings.text: According to the NHS, weight loss medication should be used by individuals with a BMI over 30. Surgeries are usually only recommended to those with a BMI of 40. Weight loss pills are also supposed to be used in conjunction with healthier lifestyle changes.

settings.title: How to lose weight naturally?
settings.text: Significant and visible weight loss can be carried out over a period of 3 months. Personal changes and goals include calculating your BMI, creating meal and dietary plans as well as including more movement in your daily life and recording any kind of progress.
